metadata.title: CVE-2021-23240 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: selinux_edit_copy_tfiles in sudoedit in Sudo before 1.9.5 allows a local unprivileged user to gain file ownership and escalate privileges by replacing a temporary file with a symlink to an arbitrary file target. This affects SELinux RBAC support in permissive mode. Machines without SELinux are not vulnerable.

notes.note: sbeattie> selinux is not the default MAC in Ubuntu, though users can boot into it.

criterions.comment: sudo package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
